file_content.text: No! I won't fail! Not again!
I'm so sorry, Parkanas. I failed you. I tried to keep the darkness from coming, but I failed.
Be calm, I'm here to help you.
Relax.
It's too late to help me. I've failed. I've failed Parkanas.
You're not the first person to mention Parkanas.
Parkanas again?
Who is Parkanas? Why is he important?
Parkanas?
He was a Padawan with us. And then a Jedi. But that was so long ago.
I don't have time for this, Sidonie.
Talk sense.
No--you don't understand. Listen to me, please.
It's my fault Parkanas died. Malachor Three. I miscalculated! He had to be left behind. He died because of me!
Vivicar! My head! Please, I can't block out his voice any longer. You must kill me to silence him.
I won't kill you, but you don't need to hear his voice again either.
Be well. [Shield her.]
Who is Lord Vivicar?
Vivicar?
Do you know who Lord Vivicar is? Or where he is?
Vivicar again.
I don't know. I can't see into his head, but he can see into mine.
Please, Jedi. You have to free me. You have to kill me.
It's not time for you to die.
No. [Shield her.]
Hold still. [Shield her.]
Jedi. What--how did you? I don't understand. My mind is clear again. And you're... weak.
Will you be alright? What did you do?
It's a shielding ritual--it should keep Lord Vivicar's voice out of your head for a while.
I shielded you.
Thank you, Jedi. I only hope the sacrifice wasn't too great.
Think nothing of it. I was only trying to help a Jedi Master.
Just my duty.
You went above and beyond your duty, Jedi.
It was that or death, so I expect some gratitude.
I saved your skin.
Of course, Jedi. I am extremely grateful.
For a while I thought I was able to block Lord Vivicar's voice from my mind.
If you hadn't been there with your calm sense, I don't know what would've happened.
I thought I was making things better, but it seems I've made tensions on Alderaan worse. Thank goodness you were here.
Master Syo will be wondering how you are.
Contact the Jedi Council.
I saw what Lord Vivicar was able to do to Master Yuon. I'm not surprised he was able to twist your thoughts as well.
Don't take it too hard.
You are most understanding, Jedi.
I don't want to think what might have happened....
You're lucky I was here.
I know, Jedi. Thank you again.
I will contact the Jedi Council--I'm sure they'll want a full explanation.
Thank you again, Jedi.
It gives me no pleasure to do this, Master Sidonie.
If you wish it. [Kill her.]
I thought you'd never ask.
My pleasure. [Kill her.]
Aaagh!
Master Sidonie!
Don't get weepy, Organa. She almost had us eating each other for dinner.
I think I can safely speak for all present when I say that the summit applauds your efforts.
Indeed--but I have to say, Jedi, I'm at a loss as to how to proceed from here.
Let there be a truce, and let the summit reconvene at a later date to work on a formal peace agreement.
Work towards peace.
House Ulgo is the true root of all of Alderaan's problems. I move that they lose their land and titles and go into exile.
Dismantle House Ulgo.
What? This is an outrage! House Ulgo are kings by right!
You are usurpers! Murderers!
Order! Order! There has been a motion. All in favor?
Aye!
Aye!
No! We won't stand for this! You will have to take our lands by force!
The summit has spoken. This meeting is adjourned.
I'm no expert on your politics. I'll let you sort it out for yourselves.
That's not my decision.
You are most humble, Jedi.
The summit will reconvene at a later date to discuss the details of a peace agreement.
And Jedi, please accept this gift from House Organa. As thanks for pulling us back from the brink.
Thank you again, Jedi.
So here it is, laid bare before you, the irrefutable evidence.
House Alde has been conspiring against House Organa for years, preying on their good trust.
House Thul is the reason the Panteer heir was assassinated. And House Ulgo is merely a puppet of House Rist.
Lies! All lies!
There are holographic recordings, documents! You can't argue with hard evidence!
We trusted you--how dare you--you will meet our armies on the field of battle!
Please, everyone. There must be another way besides war.
Let's keep this civil.
Calm down? My brother's murder went unsolved for twenty years, and you expect me to sit across from his murderer and stay calm?
Master Sidonie, what have you done?
What's going on here?
You wouldn't understand. I do this for the good of the galaxy.
You started the party without me?
Aw, I missed the fun!
Just keep quiet, Jedi. I do this for the good of the galaxy.
Master Sidonie, you have a sickness that's altering your mind.
You need help.
I have suppressed my illness. Overcome it through reason. I am thinking as I always have--in strategy, in variables and outcomes.
What you're doing is wrong.
I am a strategist, Jedi, first and foremost. I live by variables and outcomes.
On behalf of the Jedi Council, I order you to speak the truth to these people.
Recant your lies.
The Jedi Council doesn't live as I do, immersed in strategy, in variables and outcomes.
I have calculated the future, and for the galaxy to have peace, there must be war on Alderaan. I will not be shaken from this course.
I'm sorry, Master Sidonie, but I can't let that happen.
No, I won't allow it.
You are too late. All the pieces are already in place.
War isn't the answer.
No, this is it. The perfect, pure strategy.
You're a fouler liar than House Rist!
House Rist takes exception to that characterization--murderer.
That was thirty years ago!
We had an alliance!
House Organa has heard enough. It's clear to us that there can be no other course, but war.
Master Sidonie set you up for this. She would see you all destroyed.
She's deceiving you.
This child is barely more than a Padawan. Disregard her.
This child is barely more than a Padawan. Disregard him.
Master Sidonie's the only one telling any truth at this summit. Don't insult her integrity.
You would defend her, Organa. You've always been a little too friendly with the Republic.
At least they didn't murder the heir to the throne.
This is a peace summit. You will all sit down and make peace.
There will be no talk of war.
No. House Organa doesn't take kindly to being stabbed in the back.
Look who's high-and-mighty. We were kicked off Alderaan because you framed us!
Yes, and then you murdered the heir to the throne.
We didn't murder anyone. Rist did.
Yes, Rist put that usurper on the throne, but you ordered the hit.
Usurper! Our reign is as legitimate as any other!
How can you judge each other when you've all committed the same crimes?
You're all guilty.
Easy for you to say, Jedi. You don't have any stake in any of this.
Isn't there a court that can handle this sort of thing?
Let the law sort this out.
Where would you find an impartial judge? Everyone's allied to someone.
These accusations go back thirty years! Thirty years of betrayal and treachery!
Thirty more if you go to war. Don't you want to leave your children something better?
You'll be at war forever!
The Jedi has a point. Why do we have to keep doing this? All it brings is more bloodshed.
If you can't work together and trust each other at a peace summit, where can you?
Haven't you had enough lies?
Exactly. We can't trust anyone.
No--wait, doesn't the Jedi have a point? We came here to make peace.
That was before we learned each other's true colors.
Was that really such a revelation? Every one of us was guilty of something. Surely we expected everyone else to be doing the same.
No! There must be war on Alderaan! The darkness is coming and I must stop it!
Master Sidonie?
Listen to her--she wants war!
Fight the illness, Master Sidonie. Come back to the light.
Calm down, Sidonie.
That's what I've been trying to say.
I told you so.
We're sorry. We should've listened to you sooner.
You should be ashamed.
She almost succeeded.
The Jedi's right. We're so quick to fight, we don't stop to think.
No one's leaving until we have peace.
We must resolve this, now.
Enough bickering!
This isn't your fight, Jedi!
But it's convenient that Organa would make an alliance with House Teral in time for you to show up.
Yes! This is just another betrayal! This is why there can be no peace!
She's manipulating you. This war won't help Alderaan.
See? She wants a war!
Jedi, if you will not agree to be silent, then I will silence you myself!
Master Sidonie, I don't want to fight you, but this must stop.
Don't make me use force.
I have seen what must be done to ensure peace for the galaxy, and I will not back down.
I've heard enough from you, Master Sidonie.
Shut up. [Attack her]
If you go to war now, the deceptions and murders will never end. It's best to put an end to the fighting now.
[Force Persuade] No more war.
Listen, everyone! If we go to war now, the deceptions and murders will never end.
We need to put an end to the fighting now!
You're right. It'll never end.
We can't go to war now.
Thank you, Jedi. You've shown us our error.
What have you done?
I did what was best for Alderaan.
Preserved peace.
And doomed the rest of the galaxy in the process!
I just realigned their thinking on a more positive track.
I made them see reason.
And in doing so you've ruined everything!
I saved you from making a terrible mistake.
I'm trying to help you.
It's you who've made the terrible mistake.
The darkness is coming, Jedi! War must rage on Alderaan for fifty years, and only then can we put an end to the darkness!
But you haven't won yet. Once you're out of the way, I'll make them see!
Then you die. [Attack her.]
It doesn't matter. My work will live on.
I'm sorry I can't talk to you right now.
I don't know and I don't care.
